metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29955 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A transient execution vulnerability, named Floating Point Value Injection (FPVI) allowed an attacker to leak arbitrary memory addresses and may have also enabled JIT type confusion attacks. (A related vulnerability, Speculative Code Store Bypass (SCSB), did not affect Firefox.). This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.9 and Firefox < 87.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29955` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 87.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
